alert.note: Alert for Northeast Bighorn Mountains; Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 04 at 1:41AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .A slow-moving weather system will bring periods of heavy rainfall through Saturday, potentially resulting in localized flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Montana, including the following areas, Bighorn Canyon, Carter, Custer, Fallon, Powder River, Pryor/Northern Bighorn Mountains, Southern Big Horn and Southern Rosebud. Portions of north central Wyoming, including the following areas, Northeast Bighorn Mountains and Sheridan Foothills. * WHEN...Through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Burn scars may also be impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms capable of producing very heavy rainfall are expected through Saturday. Rainfall rates of 2 to 3 inches per hour are possible, and this may lead to localized flash flooding. Stay alert! - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
